intro: Ormosia dubia, commonly known as the rare rainforest tree, is a member of the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife. Due to habitat loss, Ormosia dubia is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
